page.title: 01LOCAL HISTORY(PART 1)
page.content: The 'D' Block is in the County of { {Nottinghamshire}and is 11 kilometres to the north west of the county town of Nottingham.Just outside the block is the town of Eastwood which is near to the county boundary with Derbyshire.It is probably best known as the birthplace of the {author}and playwright{D.H.Lawrence.}Most of the block is in the parish of Greasley as are the villages of Giltbrook,Watnall Beauvale,Newthorpe and Moorgreen.The edges of two towns, Kimberley and Hucknall are to the south and west of the block.Present day Giltbrook has seen many changes in recent years.An industrial estate has been built on what was formerly agricultural land and new {housing}has sprung up all over the place.
